metadata.Title: CVE-2020-16044 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use after free in WebRTC in Google Chrome prior to 88.0.4324.96 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted SCTP packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16044` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 84.0.2+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '84.0.2+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
